content: Hello, I need help with savings accounts

If you’re just starting out or want a purely digital experience, open #SaveUp or #MySaveUp. Both require only Php 1 to open and currently have no minimum monthly balance requirement (the waiver is already in effect). You’ll earn 0.0925 % p.a. as soon as your daily balance hits Php 5,000, and everything—from account opening to fund transfers—is done in the BPI mobile app.

response.message: Hello, I need help with savings accounts
response.translated_message:
Here is the translation:

"Hello, I need assistance with my savings accounts."

(Note: I kept the banking/financial context intact by using the phrase "savings accounts" instead of rephrasing it to something like "my bank accounts" or "my financial situation".)

suggestions.suggestion: If you’re just starting out or want a purely digital experience, open #SaveUp or #MySaveUp. Both require only Php 1 to open and currently have no minimum monthly balance requirement (the waiver is already in effect). You’ll earn 0.0925 % p.a. as soon as your daily balance hits Php 5,000, and everything—from account opening to fund transfers—is done in the BPI mobile app.

For parents or teens, Jumpstart Savings is ideal: Php 100 to open, Php 1,000 maintaining balance (waived for the first year), and interest starts at Php 2,000 daily balance (0.0625 % p.a.). Compared with Regular Savings (Php 3,000 to open and maintain), Jumpstart is friendlier for smaller balances while still teaching the habit of saving.

If you can keep at least Php 2 million untouched, Maxi-Saver gives the highest peso return: 0.125 % base + 0.125 % bonus (total 0.25 % p.a.) when you make no withdrawals within the month. Otherwise, #SaveUp/#MySaveUp at 0.0925 % p.a. is the next best for balances above Php 5,000.

Saver-Plus looks attractive at Php 3,000 to open, but you need Php 50,000 daily balance to earn its 0.0625 % interest—higher than the Php 5,000 needed for #SaveUp. Unless you consistently keep Php 50k+, #SaveUp or Regular Savings (Php 5,000 to earn) gives better value.

For OFWs receiving remittances, open a US Dollar Savings account (USD 500 initial deposit) or Pamana Savings (USD 1,000). Pamana adds free life insurance equal to 3× your average balance up to USD 40,000—perfect for family protection while your dollars earn 0.05 % p.a.

Stick with #SaveUp or #MySaveUp if you rarely visit branches. Both are fully digital: open via the BPI app, deposit through InstaPay/PESONet, and monitor balances in real time. All other accounts (Jumpstart, Regular, Saver-Plus, Maxi-Saver) still allow online access but may require branch visits for certain requests.
